page.title: 04Housing,Bromley,S.E.
page.content: Housing is from three periods of growth - pre-war,inter-war and post-war,with a mixture of private and council estates.The pre-war area consists of semi-detached and terraced housing.The houses in the large inter-war development are individually styled with large gardens characteristic of the 1930's.They are situated in pleasant residential roads.The post-war houses are mainly in-filling areas around the pre- and post-war housing.A new estate called St.Josephs was built in the early 1980's on the land where two large orphanages stood. A housing association built the Keniston Housing Estate seven years ago.The homes are flats,terraces or semi-detached houses,and they are rented.The Pratt's Bottom area has ribbon development along main roads, including weather boarded cottages.
